abstract.para: The crm cluster crash_test command simulates cluster failures and reports the results.

topic.para: The command supports the following checks:

listitem.para: Simulates a split-brain scenario by blocking the &corosync; port, and checks whether one node can be fenced as expected. You must install iptables before you can run this test.

Kills the daemons for &sbd;, &corosync;, or &pace;. After running one of these tests, you can find a report in the directory /var/lib/crmsh/crash_test/. The report includes a test case description, action logging, and an explanation of possible results.
Fences a specific node passed from the command line.

topic.para: For more information, run the crm cluster crash_test --help command.
The following example uses nodes called &node1; and &node2;, and tests fencing &node2;. To watch &node2; change status during the test, you can log in to &hawk; and navigate to StatusNodes.
